Basic Poké Ball; often called just a “Poké Ball”.
-10 Modifier. A better Poké Ball with no special effects.
-15 Modifier. The best generic Poké Ball.
-100 Modifier. Incredibly Rare. Worth at least 300,000. Sold nowhere.
-20 Modifier if the target is under half the level your active Pokémon is.
-20 Modifier if the target was baited into the encounter with food.
-20 Modifier if the target evolves with an Evolution Stone.
-5 Modifier. A caught Pokémon will start with +1 Loyalty.
-30 Modifier if the user has an active Pokémon that is of the same evolutionary line as the target, and the opposite gender. Does not work with genderless Pokémon.
-5 Modifier for each Weight Class the target is above 1.
-20 Modifier if the target has a Movement Capability above 7.
Given as promotional balls during sales.
-20 Modifier if you already own a Pokémon of the target’s species.
+5 Modifier. -5 to the Modifier after every round since the beginning of the encounter, until the Modifier is -20.
-20 Modifier if the target is under level 10.
-20 Modifier, if the target is Water or Bug type.
-20 Modifier, if the target was found underwater or underground.
-5 Modifier. A caught Pokémon is easily pleased and starts with a raised happiness.
-5 Modifier. A caught Pokémon will heal to Max HP immediately upon capture.
-20 Modifier. +5 to Modifier after 1 round of the encounter, +10 to Modifier after round 2, +20 to modifier after round 3.
-20 Modifier if it is dark, or if there is very little light out, when used.
-5 Modifier. A decorative Poké Ball often given out during special events.
Heals a Pokémon for 80 Hit Points and cures any Status Afflictions
Revives fainted Pokémon and sets to 20 Hit Points
Cure all Persistent Status Afflictions - Repulsive
Revives Pokémon and sets to 50% Hit Points - Repulsive
Increases the Pokémon’s Attack by two Combat Stages
Increases the Pokémon’s Defense by two Combat Stages
Increases the Pokémon’s Special Attack by two Combat Stages
Increases the Pokémon’s Special Defense by two Combat Stages
Increases the Pokémon’s Speed by two Combat Stages
Increases Critical Hit Range of all moves by +2.
Prevents reduction of Combat Stages or Accuracy on the Pokémon for five turns

Bandages are applied as Extended Actions on Pokémon or Trainers. Bandages last for 6 hours; while applied, they double the Natural Healing Rate of Pokémon or Trainers, meaning a Pokémon or Trainer will heal 1/8th of their Hit Points per half hour. Bandages also immediately heal one Injury if they remain in place for their full duration.

Poultices are applied as Extended Actions on Pokémon or Trainers. Poultices last for 6 hours; while applied, they double the Natural Healing Rate of Pokémon or Trainers, meaning a Pokémon or Trainer will heal 1/8th of their Hit Points per half hour. Poultices also immediately heal one Injury if they remain in place for their full duration. Repulsive
Snack. Grants a Digestion Buff that heals 5 Hit Points.
Snack. Grants a Digestion Buff that heals 5 Hit Points. May be used as Bait.
Snack. When their Digestion Buff is traded in, the user recovers 1/16th of their max Hit Points at the beginning of each turn for the rest of the encounter.

Poison-Type Pokémon may consume the Black Sludge as a Snack Item; when the Digestion Buff is traded in, they recover 1/8th of their Max Hit Points at the beginning of each turn for the rest of the encounter
A nutritious food that causes young Pokémon to grow quickly. When consumed, increases Experience Gain of Pokémon at level 15 or lower by 20% for the rest of the day.
Mulch may be used to temporarily increase soil Quality; it may be applied to a Plant to increase the Soil Quality of a plant by +1 for the following day. This cannot make a Soil Quality go above +2.
Eliminates the Set-Up turn of Moves with the Set-Up keyword.
Any negative Combat Stages are set to 0.
The user loses 5 HP, and gains +1 Combat Stage in a random Stat.
The user becomes Poisoned; if they do, they gain +1 Combat Stage in two random Stats.
The user is cured of Burn, Paralysis, and Poison. If they are, they lose 1 Combat Stage in a random Stat.

Tier 1 Berry. Cures Sleep, Beauty Poffin Ingredient
Tier 1 Berry. Cures Poison, Cute Poffin Ingredient
Tier 1 Berry. Cures Burn, Smart Poffin Ingredient
Tier 1 Berry. Cures Freeze, Tough Poffin Ingredient
Tier 2 Berry. Cures any single status ailment

Tier 2 Berry. Dry Treat*, Beauty Poffin Ingredient
Tier 2 Berry. Sweet Treat*, Cute Poffin Ingredient
Tier 2 Berry. Bitter Treat*, Smart Poffin Ingredient
Tier 2 Berry. Sour Treat*, Tough Poffin Ingredient
Tier 2 Berry. Increases Critical Range by +1 for the remainder of the encounter.
Tier 2 Berry. +2 CS to a random Stat. May be used only at 25% HP or lower.
Tier 2 Berry. User gains Temporary HP equal to 1/6th of their Max HP when hit by a Super Effective Move.
Tier 2 Berry. Foe dealing Physical Damage to the user loses 1/8 of their Maximum HP.
Tier 2 Berry. Foe dealing Special Damage to the user loses 1/8 of their Maximum HP.
Tier 2 Berry. Cool or Beauty Poffin Ingredient
Tier 2 Berry. Cute or Beauty Poffin Ingredient
Tier 2 Berry. Cute or Smart Poffin Ingredient
Tier 2 Berry. Smart or Tough Poffin Ingredient
Tier 2 Berry. Cool or Tough Poffin Ingredient
Tier 3 Berry. Restores a Scene Move.
Tier 3 Berry. Weakens foe's super effective Ghost-type move*
Tier 3 Berry. Weakens foe's super effective Dragon-type move*
Tier 3 Berry. Weakens foe's super effective Dark-type move*
Tier 3 Berry. Weakens foe's super effective Steel-type move*
Tier 3 Berry. Weakens foe's Normaltype move*
Tier 3 Berry. Weakens foe's supereffective Fairytype move*
Tier 3 Berry. Grants the Priority keyword to any Move. May only be used at 25% HP or lower.
Tier 3 Berry. +1 Defense CS. Activates as a Free Action when hit by a Physical Move.
Tier 3 Berry. +1 Special Defense CS. Activates as a Free Action when hit by a Special Move.
